results.title: Bell and Howell Zoomatic Director Series Model 414 PD
results.brief_description: The Bell and Howell Model is the same type of camera used by Abraham Zapruder, who was dubbed the first “citizen journalist” after he inadvertently captured the assassination of US President John F. Kennedy on camera in 1963.

constellations_primary.name: Papa-paparazzi
constellations_primary.description: Media attention and paparazzi from the assassination of JFK to Lady Gaga's music video.

results.title_for_label: Bell and Howell Zoomatic Director Series Model 414 PD
results.description: Cameras can be used to record history, but they can also become part of it as well. The Bell and Howell Model is the same type of camera used by Abraham Zapruder, who was dubbed the first “citizen journalist” after he inadvertently captured the assassination of US President John F Kennedy on camera in 1963. The footage was sold to LIFE magazine, who printed it frame-by-frame, and became a key part of the FBI investigation. The increasing popularity of home movies led to the development of more affordable technology that was common in households just like the Bell and Howell Model.
description_for_label: Cameras can be used to record history, but they can also become part of it as well. The increasing popularity of home movies led to the development of more affordable technology that was common in households just like the Bell and Howell Model.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → 05. Camera Tech → MM-05-C01

results.title: Sony Digital Handycam DCR-VX1000
results.brief_description: Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 in 1995, the same year digital video launched. It wasn’t just popular for amateurs and at-home users, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking to replace the large, expensive, shoulder mounted Betacam cameras.

constellations_primary.name: Fish-eyes and fun times
constellations_primary.description: This Constellation starts with The Favourite and ends up at Rambo, and was made by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies student Daniel Bryan.

results.description: Digital video was launched in 1995 and Sony released the Handycam DCR-VX1000 that same year. It was not only hugely popular for the amateur and at-home user, but it was also deployed by professional news outlets looking for something to replace the large, expensive, shoulder-mounted Betacam cameras. The camcorder was the answer, with high image quality matched by its affordability and portability. These same traits are what saw it became a seminal tool for the creation of skate cinema, with the Handycam DCR-VX1000 often paired with a fish-eye lens and used to record groundbreaking videos in the genre.

The camcorder was the answer, with high image quality matched by its affordability and portability. These same traits are what saw it became a seminal tool for the creation of skate cinema, with the Handycam DCR-VX1000 often paired with a fish-eye lens and used to record groundbreaking videos in the genre.

results.title: Clapperboard (studio of Mirka Mora)
results.brief_description: Clapperboard made from wood and painted black and white, board has cloth tape around middle and bottom sections. Back of board has a piece of paper attached with rows of numbers.

results.title: Did you ask the river?
results.credit_line:
Joan Ross
Mordant Family VR Commission, ACMI Collection
Developed in collaboration with Dr Josh Harle at Tactical Space Lab, Sydney
results.material_description: software, video, props, colour and sound
results.brief_description:
‘Did you ask the river?’ is the debut VR work from one of Australia’s leading visual artists, Joan Ross.

In the style of a first-person videogame, participants are given free rein to explore an interactive 3D extension of Ross’s vibrant, yet unsettling, colonial landscapes.

Unlike many VR experiences, participants are placed in a body – that of an 18th century colonial woman – and become uncomfortably complicit in her unwitting destruction of the landscape.
